messages.content: You are tasked with creating a structured output from the provided user message.

Full HTTP request path
- /api/v1/posts/{post}/comments

HTTP methods acceptance (based strictly on the code)
- All HTTP methods acceptable: false
  - The index method is registered only for GET (via Route::apiResource(...)->only('index')).
- HEAD: false
  - There is no explicit HEAD route defined for this endpoint in the code.
- POST: false
  - The index method handles GET only; there is a separate POST route for store under a different middleware/group, but not for this index method.
- OPTIONS: false
  - No explicit OPTIONS route is defined for this endpoint in the code.
- TRACE: false
  - Not defined in the code.
- GET: true
  - The index method is defined for GET via the apiResource with only('index') on the nested resource.
- PUT: false
- DELETE: false
- PATCH: false

Explanation
- The endpoint is defined as a nested API resource: posts.comments for PostCommentController. The index method (which returns the post's comments) is registered publicly (outside the auth middleware) as a GET route at the nested path. Therefore, the path is /api/v1/posts/{post}/comments, and only GET is explicitly registered for this controller method.
- There is a separate route inside the authenticated group that registers POST /api/v1/posts/{post}/comments for the store method, but that is a different HTTP method acting on a different controller method, not the index method. Hence, for the index method, only GET is acceptable, and other methods (HEAD, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, OPTIONS, TRACE) are not defined for this specific endpoint in the code.
